conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C, we need to follow these steps:
The process from B to C is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
From the diagram, the pressure at state B and C is \(0.6p_0\).
The volume at state B is \(0.5V_0\).
The volume at state C is \(V_0\).

premise: The volume at state B is \(0.5V_0\). The volume at state C is \(V_0\).
conclusion: The change in volume, \(\Delta V\), is \(V_0 - 0.5V_0 = 0.5V_0\).
For an isobaric process, the work done \(W\) is given by \(W = P \Delta V\).

premise: The pressure at state B and C is \(0.6p_0\). The change in volume, \(\Delta V\), is \(0.5V_0\).
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is \(0.3p_0V_0\).
conclusion: The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is \(0.3p_0V_0\).
